page.title: 01AN INTRODUCTION TO HAXEY
page.content: Haxey is a village ,in between Doncaster and Scunthorpe, in South Humberside.From Doncaster it is around 15 miles.The direction from Doncaster is east.The population is around 1500. It has a lot of arable farming the main crops are grain(mainly wheat and barley), sugar beet and potatoes. The area is well known for strip farming,one of the few places in the country. The terrain is quite flat,it is also drained fenland-marshland. The housing is a variety of old and new houses and there is also a lot of new building taking place. There are quite a few commuters in Haxey.Most of the employment in Haxey is mainly farming and allied trades, which is selling and servicing farming machinery. On every January 6 there is a Haxey
